a0.speaker: Sakuya:
a0.dialogue: This place is filled with a purplish mist!?

a1.speaker: Sakuya:
a1.dialogue: I hope I won't get a deadly virus or get sick from a fungus-like being while traversing this...

a2.dialogue: You are a bit too over-the-top.

a3.speaker: Ayaka:
a3.dialogue: If there are any viruses in the mist, it must be Reverence's wrath upon trespassers like you.

a4.speaker: Ayaka:
a4.dialogue: You would be swollen to the point beyond recognition and will have no guts.

a5.speaker: Sakuya:
a5.dialogue: I don't believe in gods anyway.

a6.speaker: Ayaka:
a6.dialogue: That is because you haven't seen her yourself.

a7.speaker: Ayaka:
a7.dialogue: She will come to this land in the same manner as when she appeared to me several years ago.

a8.speaker: Ayaka:
a8.dialogue: By then, the frail bubble of this sinful world shall burst, and a new eternal bubble shall be created in its place.

a9.speaker: Sakuya:
a9.dialogue: This is a load of waste. As far as I know, the universe is infinite, or apparently, it is.

a10.speaker: Sakuya:
a10.dialogue: You are simply thinking like those stupid flat-Earthers. Saying gods exist even when they haven't seen one by flesh.

a11.speaker: Sakuya:
a11.dialogue: Even if they did appear to some people like what I heard, these are just false.

a12.speaker: Sakuya:
a12.dialogue: And worst of all, you're thinking the world is inside a bubble.

a13.speaker: Ayaka:
a13.dialogue: An undeniable truth is that Reverence is omnipresent in all planes of existence, including the spiritual and material.

a14.speaker: Ayaka:
a14.dialogue: Throughout history, many have attempted to unify with her and transcend this world; none prevailed.

a15.speaker: Ayaka:
a15.dialogue: As I, a Mystic who was chosen by Reverence in order to join Her holy silence...

a16.speaker: Ayaka:
a16.dialogue: Your nous should be sewn shut to the Darkness of Oblivion as my nous began to open in her light!
